meanings.definition: A writing implement typically consisting of a thin stick of graphite enclosed in a cylinder of wood or metal
meanings.sent1: I used my pensils to draw a picture of my cat.
meanings.sent2: She always carries her pensils in her backpack for school.
meanings.sent3: The pensils rolled off the table and onto the floor, creating a funny sound.
meanings.sent4: His pensils danced across the paper, bringing the landscape to life.
meanings.sent5: The pensils in the art store came in a rainbow of colors, tempting me to buy them all.

meanings.definition: To write or draw with a pencil
meanings.sent1: I pensil my name on the top of the test paper.
meanings.sent2: She pensils her thoughts in a journal every night before bed.
meanings.sent3: He pensils a secret message on the back of the letter to his friend.
meanings.sent4: The artist pensils intricate patterns on the canvas with precision.
meanings.sent5: Pensiling on the wall is not allowed in this classroom.

meanings.definition: A cosmetic in a stick form used for outlining the eyes or lips
meanings.sent1: She applied the pensils to her eyes to create a dramatic look.
meanings.sent2: The makeup artist always carries her pensils in her kit for touch-ups.
meanings.sent3: The pensils in her makeup bag seemed to multiply every time she checked.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled as she used the pensils to enhance their natural beauty.
meanings.sent5: The pensils glided smoothly along her lips, leaving a perfect outline.
